title: Growing and Knowing Lavender (gnv64)
description:
Growing and Knowing Lavender
By John Mason
ACS Distance Education | ISBN: 978-0-9925878-0-2 | True PDF | 117 pages | 15.8 mb

Lavender is perhaps one of the most popular herbs grown worldwide. Thousands of acres of lavender are grown commercially, particularly in Europe, for lavender oil which is mainly used in cosmetics and soaps.
The plants are ideal for hedges, garden shrubs and topiary. Dried flowers are used in potpourri, sachets, Sand other crafts. Dried flowers are also sometimes used in cooking (e.g. to flavour bread or biscuits).
